result.execSummary:
The defendant Reyes Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Cases called 16CF90, 16CM73 and 15CM36.  Defendant Reyes  Ramos Gomez in court with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended informations filed in 16CF90 and 16CM73 - Atty. Klomberg hands paper copy to the Court, will be e-filed.  Court reviews agreement.  Restittution for 5/16/16 incident (year is wrong in stip - corrected on record).  Court finds victims rights compliance based on Atty. Klomberg's representation.  Court addresses case 16CM73 charges/penalties.  DE pleads NC to count 3 of amended information- 16CM73, possession of paraphernalia.  Count 5 of 16CM73, as in amended information, DC - DE pleads NC.  16CF90 - review of charge penalty.  DE pleads NC to count 1 of 16CF90 as in the amended information.  15CM36 - DE agrees in violation of DPA; Court revokes the DPA and finds guilty, enters judgment of conviction as to Count 2.  Court reviews PQWOR with defendant.  Court reviews Voting and firearms restrictions. Atty. Klomberg heard on factual basis for amended charges.  Court finds factual basis.  Court heard, finds pleas made FVKI, accepts pleas and finds guilty of Counts 3 and 5 of AI on 16CM73;  count 1 of AI on 16CF90, all other counts of those cases are DRI. Atty. Klomberg is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Dahnert is heard.  Defendant is heard.  Court heard and sentence imposed:

15CM36:
Costs - Court does not believe DNA surcharge applies.

16CF90 and 16CM73:
Sentence withheld, 
Probation for 30 months;
60 days DCJ imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent upon rules violation, to be tagged to Count 1 of 16CF90.
Psychological evalutaion if requested by agent.
Comply with required treatment and medication as prescribed.
Costs and Restitution of $3929.45 to be paid through the COC - bond money to be applied - restitution directly to DCSO.
DNA sample and surcharge.

Expungement will be available on 16CF90; will not be available on 16CM73.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Continuance
Continuance
Telephone conference on July 10, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Reyes Ramos in court, Kurt Frederich Klomberg and Atty Robert Barrington (as co-counsel) appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney William Ginsberg appeared by phone means for Defendant Reyes Ramos. Def.'s parent appear in court. Ct. heard regarding status of matter. Atty Klomberg heard on position, questions on how to force medication compliance, requests court give parents guidance if Def. would refuse to take medication. Court heard, shares concern. Atty Ginsberg heard, also shares concerns, heard further regarding taking of prescription and what could be done if Def. refuses to take it. Court heard. Atty Ginsberg heard regarding health insurance, will comply w/ what Court orders. Court heard. Atty Klomber heard regarding bond provisions, and health insurance/Badger Care. Court heard, requiring, w/i one week, that the Court hears from Atty Ginsberg regarding efforts to get a doctor in place. Atty Ginsberg heard. Atty Klomberg heard, requests suggestions from Atty Ginsberg regarding moving case(s) forward. Atty Ginsberg heard, agrees, discusses status of matters.  Court heard, sets prelim. hearing for 16CF90 and status hearing for all cases.


  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

16CF90, 15CM36 & 16CM73: Defendant Reyes Ramos Gomez in court, in custody.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brian D. Hamill appeared by phone means for Defendant Reyes  Ramos Gomez.  Atty. Bill Ginsberg also appears by phone; Atty. Hamill is requesting to withdraw and/or substitute Atty. Ginsberg in this case; Court will approve the substitution; Atty. Hamill disconnects; Atty. Ginsberg heard on competency report, found competent; Def. heard, believes he is competent and does not need hearing for same; Court finds Def. competent to proceed; State moves the report and Court will rec'v same and agrees that Def. is competent; State heard on concern that Def. will stop making medications that helped return to competency and the $10,000 Cash has been posted; discussion on how to enforce same; State requesting that Def. be held at Mendota until a short hearing could be held later in the week; Atty. Ginsberg heard; Court finds Def. competent and is assuming Def. will be released and Court orders bond modified to include: Def. must continue taking psychotropic medications as currently prescribed until the court rules otherwise; Atty. Ginsberg needs to know that the actual prescription is, how to review compliance; Court sets review hearing 12/1/16 at 4pm; Atty. Ginsberg may appear by phone if an agreement has been reached on compliance; modified bond sent to jail; Def. notes all his belonging are here with him, except medications/prescription; Atty. Ginsberg will call Mendota and obtain prescription so Def. can take yet today

15CM36, 16CF90 & 16CM73 - Defendant Reyes  Ramos in court with attorney Brian D. Hamill.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel acknowledge receipt of Dr. Schoenecker's report.  Atty Hamill does not agree with findings, feels def does not need inpatient treatment but does need help understanding these proceedings.  State would like Dr. Schoenecker to testify.  Court questions def on competency, def feels he is competent..  State calls Dr. Schoenecker, S/T by phone.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court heard and finds def not competent and finds that competency can be restored.  Def ordered into an inpatient treatment facility.  State request def remanded to the Dodge County Jail and cash bail be modified.  Atty Hamill objects.  Court heard, previously found probable cause and modifies cash bail from $1,000 to $10,000.  Def remanded to custody of Dodge County Sheriff until DHS determines what facility shall be held at.  Cash bail previously posted is to be returned.
Competency Hearing 6/20/16

9:05 - Defendant Reyes Ramos in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Atty Shelton states defendant stands mute. Court enters Not Guilty plea on defendant's behalf. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
